content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  September 06 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed the Issuer Default Ratings (IDRs) for Toys 'R' Us  Inc. (Toys  or the Holdco)  Toys 'R' Us - Delaware  Inc.  Toys 'R' Us Property Co. I  LLC and TRU Taj LLC at 'CCC'. Fitch has also upgraded the Toys-Delaware B-4 term loan to 'B-/RR2' from 'CCC+/RR3' and withdrawn the IDR of Toys 'R' Us Property Co. II  LLC. A full list of rating actions follows at the end of this release. KEY RA
name: DaVita Inc
title: Fitch Affirms Toys 'R' Us' IDR at 'CCC'

content: WASHINGTON DaVita Healthcare Partners Inc  the largest provider of dialysis services in the United States  has agreed to pay $450 million to resolve claims that it violated the False Claims Act  the U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday.
name: DaVita Inc
title: DaVita Healthcare Partners to pay $450 million for violating False Claims Act: Justice Department

content: WASHINGTON  June 24 DaVita Healthcare Partners Inc  the largest provider of dialysis services in the United States  has agreed to pay $450 million to resolve claims that it violated the False Claims Act  the U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday.
name: DaVita Inc
title: DaVita Healthcare Partners to pay $450 mln for violating False Claims Act -U.S. Justice Dept.

content: A federal judge in Colorado has declined to certify a class of patients who said Colorado-based healthcare clinic operator DaVita Healthcare Partners administered potentially hazardous dialysis products that increased their risk of suffering a heart attack.
name: DaVita Inc
title: DaVita dialysis patients lose bid for class certification

content: DaVita HealthCare Partners Inc  one of the largest U.S. kidney dialysis providers  said it agreed to pay $450 million to settle a whistleblower lawsuit accusing it of deliberately wasting medicines in order to receive higher Medicare payments.
name: DaVita Inc
title: DaVita to pay $450 million in Medicare fraud lawsuit over wasted drugs

content: May 4 DaVita HealthCare Partners Inc  one of the largest U.S. kidney dialysis providers  said it agreed to pay $450 million to settle a whistleblower lawsuit accusing it of deliberately wasting medicines in order to receive higher Medicare payments.
name: DaVita Inc
title: DaVita to pay $450 mln in Medicare fraud lawsuit over wasted drugs

content: NEW YORK  March 24 Humana Inc  one of the largest U.S. providers of Medicare Advantage healthcare plans for older people  said on Tuesday that it believes a previously disclosed government query for information is part of a wider review involving many healthcare companies.
name: DaVita Inc
title: UPDATE 1-Humana says previously disclosed DOJ query involves other companies
